alert.note: Alert for Clark; Hot Spring (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 11 at 12:58PM CDT until May 14 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Ouachita River At Arkadelphia affecting Hot Spring and Clark Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ouachita River At Arkadelphia. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Roads are flooding, including, Nix`s Ferry, Clark County roads 9 and 28, and State Highway 7 and 51 east of Arkadelphia. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 16.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.0 feet Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 1 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Crest Time Date Ouachita River Arkadelphia 17.0 16.7 Thu 12 PM 21.4 17.0 12.4 22.0 7 AM 5/12 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
